intro: Maieta guianensis var. leticiana, commonly known as the Guianese maieta, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly found in the Amazon rainforest. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus, and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, reaching heights of up to 1.5 meters, with hairy stems and broad, heart-shaped leaves. Its flowers are usually pink to purple in color and bloom during the warmer months, attracting pollinators such as bees and hummingbirds.
